greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the parts i_1 + i_2 + ... + i_{A001222(n)} of the unique strict partition with encoding n = Product_{j=1..A001222(n)} prime(i_j-j+1).
comment: A strict partition is a partition into distinct parts.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
example: n = 12 = 2*2*3 = prime(1)*prime(1)*prime(2) encodes strict partition [1,2,4].  So a(12) = 1+2+4 = 7.  Value a(n) = 7 occurs A000009(7) = 5 times, for n in {12, 17, 21, 22, 25}.
mathematica: a[n_] := Function[l, Sum[l[[j]]+j-1, {j, 1, Length[l]}]][Sort[ Flatten[ Table[ Array[ PrimePi[i[[1]]]&, i[[2]]], {i, FactorInteger[n]}]]]];
Array[a,100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 23 2017, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 29 2015
